parameters.text:
=scrape the below medium blog URL and do setimant analysis:
{{ $json.blogURL }}

parameters.content:
## 🔹 SECTION 1: Start the Workflow & Provide Input

🧩 Nodes:

* 🔘 When clicking 'Execute workflow' → ✅ Renamed: Start Manually
* 📝 Edit Fields (Manual Input) → ✅ Renamed: Set Medium Blog URL

💡 What This Does:
You start the workflow manually and provide the blog post URL from Medium. This is done using a simple field, so no coding is needed.

📌 Example:
You paste a Medium blog URL like:

```
https://medium.com/some-author/the-future-of-openai-in-ai-innovation-abc123
```

🔍 Why It’s Useful:

* 🧠 You can analyze any blog post from Medium.
* 🧑‍💼 Great for researchers, marketers, or founders tracking OpenAI mentions in the blogosphere.

🎯 Beginner Tip:
Just click ▶ Execute, then paste your Medium URL when prompted!

## 🤖 SECTION 2: AI Agent Fetches & Filters Content

🧩 Main Node:

* 🤖 AI Agent → ✅ Renamed: Scrape Blog for OpenAI Mentions

🔧 Sub-Nodes Connected:

* 🧠 OpenAI Chat Model → Processes your goal (e.g., “Find OpenAI mentions”)
* 🌐 MCP Client (Tool: scrape\_as\_markdown) → Actually visits and scrapes the Medium post
* 🧾 Structured Output Parser → Formats the scraped content into clean, structured data

💡 What This Does:
This is the powerhouse of your workflow! Here's what happens:

1. The AI Agent receives your input (blog URL and goal).
2. It activates a special scraping tool via Bright Data MCP called scrape\_as\_markdown.
3. The AI intelligently finds paragraphs or sections that mention OpenAI.
4. The result is then parsed into structured, easy-to-read text.

🔍 Why It’s Useful:

* 🔬 No more reading entire blogs manually—get only the content that matters.
* 🧠 Uses ChatGPT to understand meaning, not just raw keyword match.
* 🕵️ Perfect for media monitoring, market research, and trend tracking.

🎯 Beginner Tip:
You don’t need to worry about scraping or code. The AI + MCP handle everything behind the scenes!

## 📊 SECTION 3: Store the Results in Google Sheets

🧩 Node:

* 📄 Google Sheets (Append Row) → ✅ Renamed: Save to Google Sheets

💡 What This Does:
Once the filtered and formatted content is ready, it is automatically saved into your connected Google Sheet.

📌 What Gets Saved:

* Blog title or URL
* Extracted paragraphs that mention OpenAI
* (Optional) Date or time for historical tracking

📊 Why It’s Useful:

* 📁 Centralized content in one place
* 📈 Enables easy data tracking, comparison, or sharing
* ✅ Great for building automated research reports

🎯 Beginner Tip:
You can open the Google Sheet any time to view the results — no export needed!

# 🧠Track Brand Mentions Across Platforms

This automation scrapes a Medium blog post (you provide the URL) and pulls out content that mentions OpenAI, then stores it into Google Sheets.

Let’s break it down by sections ⬇️

---

## 🔹 SECTION 1: Start the Workflow & Provide Input

🧩 Nodes:

* 🔘 When clicking 'Execute workflow' → ✅ Renamed: Start Manually
* 📝 Edit Fields (Manual Input) → ✅ Renamed: Set Medium Blog URL

💡 What This Does:
You start the workflow manually and provide the blog post URL from Medium. This is done using a simple field, so no coding is needed.

📌 Example:
You paste a Medium blog URL like:

```
https://medium.com/some-author/the-future-of-openai-in-ai-innovation-abc123
```

🔍 Why It’s Useful:

* 🧠 You can analyze any blog post from Medium.
* 🧑‍💼 Great for researchers, marketers, or founders tracking OpenAI mentions in the blogosphere.

🎯 Beginner Tip:
Just click ▶ Execute, then paste your Medium URL when prompted!

---

## 🤖 SECTION 2: AI Agent Fetches & Filters Content

🧩 Main Node:

* 🤖 AI Agent → ✅ Renamed: Scrape Blog for OpenAI Mentions

🔧 Sub-Nodes Connected:

* 🧠 OpenAI Chat Model → Processes your goal (e.g., “Find OpenAI mentions”)
* 🌐 MCP Client (Tool: scrape\_as\_markdown) → Actually visits and scrapes the Medium post
* 🧾 Structured Output Parser → Formats the scraped content into clean, structured data

💡 What This Does:
This is the powerhouse of your workflow! Here's what happens:

1. The AI Agent receives your input (blog URL and goal).
2. It activates a special scraping tool via Bright Data MCP called scrape\_as\_markdown.
3. The AI intelligently finds paragraphs or sections that mention OpenAI.
4. The result is then parsed into structured, easy-to-read text.

🔍 Why It’s Useful:

* 🔬 No more reading entire blogs manually—get only the content that matters.
* 🧠 Uses ChatGPT to understand meaning, not just raw keyword match.
* 🕵️ Perfect for media monitoring, market research, and trend tracking.

🎯 Beginner Tip:
You don’t need to worry about scraping or code. The AI + MCP handle everything behind the scenes!

---

## 📊 SECTION 3: Store the Results in Google Sheets

🧩 Node:

* 📄 Google Sheets (Append Row) → ✅ Renamed: Save to Google Sheets

💡 What This Does:
Once the filtered and formatted content is ready, it is automatically saved into your connected Google Sheet.

📌 What Gets Saved:

* Blog title or URL
* Extracted paragraphs that mention OpenAI
* (Optional) Date or time for historical tracking

📊 Why It’s Useful:

* 📁 Centralized content in one place
* 📈 Enables easy data tracking, comparison, or sharing
* ✅ Great for building automated research reports

🎯 Beginner Tip:
You can open the Google Sheet any time to view the results — no export needed!

---

## ✅ Summary: Why This Workflow Rocks

| Feature                   | Benefit                             |
| ------------------------- | ----------------------------------- |
| 🔗 Input Any Blog         | Works on any Medium URL             |
| 🧠 AI + Bright Data MCP   | Smart & human-like scraping         |
| 🔎 Focused on “OpenAI”    | Filters only relevant content       |
| 📊 Saves to Google Sheets | Easy analysis, no manual copy/paste |

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "platform": "Blog",
  "author": "Sam Enfield",
  "title": "Why OpenAI Suddenly Erased Jony Ive from their Website",
  "content summary": "The article discusses a vanished partnership between OpenAI and Jony Ive, Apple's legendary designer behind iconic products like the iMac, iPod, iPhone, iPad, and Apple Watch. The collaboration aimed to create a sleek, intuitive AI consumer device dubbed the \"iPhone of artificial intelligence,\" backed by billions in funding and design philosophy from Apple. However, all traces of this collaboration suddenly disappeared online—blog posts, announcement videos, promotional pages, and introductions were deleted or wiped clean. The article reveals that this abrupt removal is linked to a trademark lawsuit that emerged, reshaping the future of AI.",
  "sentiment": "Negative"
}
